## Automated Radiosonde Launching System (ARLS) Installation and Automated Weather Station (AWS) Preparation at the Kuujjuak Upper Air Station

**Proposal Reference:** cb-615-65078815  
**Publication Date:** 18 March 2024  
**Tender Closing Date:** 26 April 2024, 15:00:00   
**Contract Duration:** 01 May 2024 – 30 September 2024

**Objective:**  
Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC)’s Meteorological Services are seeking a contractor to prepare the installation site for the Automated Radiosonde Launching System (ARLS) and Automated Weather Station (AWS) at the Kuujjuak Upper Air Station in Kuujjuaq, Quebec.  

**Scope of Work:**  
The contractor will be responsible for:

* Supplying a gravel pad and foundations for the ARLS (20' x 8' ISO shipping container)
* Installing conduit and electrical services to supply a power feed from the Operations building to the ARLS, including electrical grounding
* Installing conduit and electrical services to supply a communications cable from the Operations building to the ARLS
* Installing a gated, 6' chain link fence around the perimeter of the Kuujjuak Upper Air Station (~55m x 60m)

**Contract Documents:**

* Proposal documentation, including a request for proposal and contract agreement, can be found at [insert link]
* Technical specifications for the ARLS and AWS can be found at [insert link]
* Detailed specifications for the installation and site preparation are outlined in the Tender FAQs

**Contract Requirements:**

* The contractor must have expertise and resources to complete the scope of work
* The contractor must comply with all relevant safety and environmental regulations
* The contractor must complete the scope of work within the specified contract duration
